work_equality: Well, the idea that there is equality is not true, specifically when it comes to a career.  At all levels of my career there were obstacles for me as a women in science. When I was studying there was still the prejudice about a women studying in computer science, that they might not be capable, that a computer scientist cannot be pretty and clever, ... In my studies it was clearly mentioned by male students that they would never accept a women as a boss (1989). This might have changed but is was the mindset of that time. In all levels of my career I was the only women. When I had success it was then sometimes mentioned that it was because I was a women. Womens' topics and talking about equality was for decades something that women - such as me - were fighting for - it took until around 2020 when more men were stepping in and understanding equality as a responsibility for all genders. I have lost 20% of my intellectual potential and time because I was a women, because I had to show more to get the same positions, because I had to spend time in committee meetings when others made their careers, because I was not in the right boys networks, ... That is a loss not only for me but also a loss for a society as this did not happen to me but to many women.
label: Prejudice
work_equality_solution: Never give up, connect in women networks, reveal the inequality in all places and situations I see it, mentor young women, give women a voice, make institutions change and implement gender equality plans. ... keep moving forward.
work_unsupported: For too many years I felt it was alway me mentioning to respect and be aware of inequality. For a decade I mentioned it in so many meeting, that it is not only Mitarbeiter but also Mitarbeiterin, that it is not man month but person months and so on.  Women were responsible for gender quality. Women who were acting to make change got a negative image as "Emanze" (feminist). The universities took and my institute took a long time to finally implement better rules for gender quality. Only in 2021 we see some gender equality plan  now on the university level, on the level of European Projects and so on. But is was a very long and low process.
work_unsupported_solution: Sticking to it, meeting and exchanging with other women, building networks of women. Promoting young women and giving them the support I never had.
work_collaborations: As I was often the only one, the rules on the table were that of men. But at the same time when I behave - as aggressively - as them i was the "bitch", I was difficult, I  was having "hair on teeth".  One not only had to work on one's own career but also had to navigate this with competing men who played not always fair.
work_collaborations_solution: Coaching, Courses, Networking. That has helped a lot.

work_equality: Why, you are never equal! E.g. no chances to get a W3 position. No chances to get positions in University politics, as long as an old man is available for the same job. etc. There is no equality at University.
label: Politics
work_unsupported: During my time of qualification, there was no support for equality.
work_collaborations: Often ignored, best be loud and present. Another working way would be: forget to be the idea giver. Introduce your ideas to the leading men at the place and let them sell them as their own. At least then you can start to work constructively.

work_equality: To be exact, after my return to Germany. I gave a long answer before.
label: family_planning/undermining
work_unsupported: Wheras men are supportet and invited, for example to publish with the boss and getting great recommendation letters for applying to professorships my female colleagues and I are doing the ground work, teaching for example but that doesn' count it is expected of women that they pick up the slack that some men don't like to do. The old buddy network is well alive and younger cohorts of male scientists are socialized into the old paradigm.
work_collaborations: Irefered to it in my comment before.
work_infrastructure: Women still don't ask enough and are constantly afraid that someone could be angry with them or not liking them because that's what they learned and what men still expect of women. I don't follow those ruels and because I make known what I can and what I want I get the label of being aggressive. I don't really care I am old enough to handle it and I have enough experience but my younger colleagues don't. I also see the issues of men though. They don't ask for family leave or only the two months because it's still not acknowledge that many times a child has two parents.

work_collaborations: Being talked over and ignored, having less published output because male colleagues tend to care less about how good their output is

work_unsupported: No full time jobs for women, only for male phd students

work_equality: Participating at a event as "statutory woman"
label: Undermining
work_equality_solution:
Deciding on my own if I -want- to participate in the event.
Taking the chance anyway.

work_unsupported_solution: I looked for new contexts of exchange relationships on an informal base

work_equality: the german are alloways choosen by companies
label: Ininternationality
work_unsupported: Men allways have the priority to travel foe working, seminars or conferences

work_equality: Regarding the performance and achievements, I should have been more recognized than I was.  Colleagues from other countries were really surprised about that.
label: Expertise_perception
work_unsupported: I have only be supported by some nice colleagues from Germany and other countries. My supervisor and the official institutions did not support me -- to use friendly words.
work_unsupported_solution: One important measure was to change the university. The other was to not care and simply do research.

work_equality:
I was lucky not to have faced serious discrimination, just a few anekdotes. During my studies a collegue answered to all of my question with "And you dont know this?" And then explained things. It took me some semesters to realize that he had not the slightest clue im most of the times and was just talking nonsense. He did not behave the same way to our male collegues. 
Lately (Im at the very end of my phd) I sometimes here the comment (when talking about becoming professors) that I have high chances to become one because Im a woman. Not because im skilled or eager. Just because women are prefered in generell. (Which is depatable in my opinion having under 10% female professors in my field in Germany). I also participate in a networking programm for female scientists and very often my male collegues and my professor feel discriminated because they are not allowed to take part in it (not to say that similar courses are offered by the gradschool for all genders which the very same collegues never participate in).
label: Undermining
work_equality_solution: Well, just have the facts at hand and tell them that their opinion is not reflecting the reality and that man still dont suffer generic discrimination in the hard sciences.

work_equality:
Male colleagues were more often praised and encouraged, even when they were not as productive and did not take as much responsility as i did.
It was rather depressing when i was more often at work and actually got more work done as a part time worker, than my male colleague with full time (and full pay!) and still, he got praised, while i was ignored.
label: Salary_Expectation
work_unsupported: Having kids and supporting women was a big thing, until it really happened. Then it was a nuissance at work.

work_equality: Non-research tasks at work (at the institute) are often applied to women, because it is assumed that women do better in the, e.g., included organizational aspects of non-research work (which is possibly true, but leads to situations, where women very often do big parts of the non-research stuff, while men can focus on their own research).
label: Undermining

work_collaborations: With some men, esp. in my own lab, I find it sometimes hard to collaborate since their style of communication appears to be rather egocentric than collaborative.
work_collaborations_solution: I adapated some sort of communication of being more straight forward, strincter and communicating my needs directly but friendly.

work_collaborations: Adoption of results which I was the PI for.
Some men have been sexist or did not see their priviledges

work_equality: different expectation for men and women
label: Meet_expectations

work_infrastructure: see above: Equimpent with too high windows, handles,...
work_infrastructure_solution: see above: Footstool, help, diverse group

work_others: Short term working contract at the university is stressfull (no clear perspective)

work_unsupported: It is really hard to get a research paper and guidance in particular topic. If research paper is free then you can download it but if not then leave it. Same applies of Norms..
work_unsupported_solution:
Whenever I need a norms I just write email to everyone asking for it. If someone have it I get it. 
For research paper there is no solution. Even finding books is also tough. 
There is a rocket chat now by which we can ask specific question to the group.

work_others: During my pregancy I was not sure, if I could go into all laboratories or if there were dangerous materials stored or had been used inside

work_equality:
The feeling, not being taken seriously
- payment
- prejudices
- verbal offensive
- not taken into account, that being parents involve lot of work. This surely also holds for fathers, however fathers only a few years ago started to be more present.
label: Prejudice Salary_expectation/ family_planning/childcare/ Male_communication
work_unsupported:
- For many "minor" things, i never asked for support, except of my family
- no real dual career support
- awareness of problems and support for having a family and plan a scientific career at the same time
work_unsupported_solution:
I had children only after my PhD. 
I renounced a pure academic career.
I did work part-time, although it was not helpful for the career.
work_collaborations:
-arrogance, despite equal or minor competence
- being made insecure
- impudence
work_collaborations_solution: Searching working groups, where the athmosphere is convenient, and quit the others as soon as possible.

work_infrastructure: lack of information on how to establish internatonal cooperation, short term stay aborad with small children
work_others:
corona: work from home is the insitutional agenda, however postal messages and forms are not forwarded. 
difficulty when onboarding that the new university and research institute: mobile onboarding covers administration but not and "explanation" about administrative ways and organizational culture.

work_equality: An old professor told me not to wear skirts, because women don't fit in computer science.
label: Conventions
work_equality_solution: I talked with friends about my feelings and tried to not speak to that professor again.
work_collaborations: Sometimes and only sometimes men do not accept me. It happened once because of the cultural background and sometimes without a real reason, maybe because I was the only woman, maybe because I had other ideas in group work. I really don't like these jokes about women and technology, which are used to lough about me and other female students.
work_collaborations_solution: When circumstances allow, I talk to supervisors or the project leader. When I was a student, I once talked to the course supervisors. It didn't really help, but I learned to ignore those persons.

work_collaborations: In der Zusammenarbeit mit Männers herrscht eine deutlich agressiver Umganston. Das schreckt mich oft ab, mit ihnen zusammenarbeiten zu wollen.

work_equality: Usually, it was assumed that I have not studied and have no work experience. I was regularly told to that "for being sure" they assume I have no relevant work experience. So, I was considered a job beginner at every job. When a new male colleague came, he was welcomed as "one man more in the team" and given real work from the beginning. I was told they have no time for explaining me their work I shall sit and read something and not keep others from working. So, the treatment was different from the beginning., I had different tasks and when I complained, they again explained me the difference between men and women. Men are colleagues, women are constant trainees.
label: Prejudice/Undermining
work_collaborations: As long as I was young and asking only questions, it was OK for them. Men like to explain things to women and feel superior. But when I started having work experience and my own opinion, there was a lot of resistance against working with me.

label: Salary_Expectation/Men_promote_men
work_collaborations: Do not take serious. Think that stop to work after marriage / children. Continue work in pubs and at sports events where women are not present. Think that your task is to serve them. Take your results and claim for themselves.

work_unsupported: Still we are afraid to address certain topics in a bottom up process. We need a topdown compromise. Culture is behind in that aspect.
work_collaborations: I had fantastic and horrible experiences both with women and men but I would like to highlight that as architecture and planning in the precedent generation of mine was mainly a men discipline, sometimes I feel in minority in certain activities. From this minority is more difficult to empower.

work_unsupported: Not so much promotion for the foreign scientists

work_collaborations: Older people at the institute made very misogynist comments or were commenting on my outfits when they thought they were nice (although I had no contact with these people otherwise); some collaborators took my male students more serious than me, although I was the project leader; I was told to smile more after a talk instead of any scientific input; I needed to tell people off for flirting instead of working with me.
work_collaborations_solution: I tried not to interact with these people
work_infrastructure: There was only one female bathroom with one toilet on my floor; I often had to go several floors down if someone else was using it, which was more often than not with four female secretaries, one other female student and me sharing this one bathroom. The male bathroom right next to it had 4 cubicles.

work_unsupported: many social aspects are structured around going out late at night with in most cases just men. These are rather subtle things. but collaborations are best with people one likes to hang out with have fun and in most cases beers. Despite this being unproblematic for myself I see lots of my female colleagues with different cultural or personal backgrounds not participating in these activities which ultimately lead to less equality.

work_equality: the equal opportunities officer himself uses sexist slides in his lecture...
label: Male_communication
work_collaborations: lack of understanding / refusal to 'gender' (use male and female form for occupations words etc. as opposed to only using the male form in writing)
work_collaborations_solution: insisting to do that in written form and lead discussions about it
